textBeforeTable: AlertQuoteReply Please, would someone be willing to walk this through with me? My goal is to learn the technique of producing a 3-shot HDR composite image. Of course, first I need to come up with the images. Does the D-90 have the capability to: Automatically, i.e. "burst" mode (single shutter depression) take 3 shots a) 2 stops apart (meter - under - over) b) with each of them taken 2-3 seconds from each other? Can it be set-up so that with one depression you obtain what you need for an HDR image? I have unstable hands so if I press the shutter 3x instead of once its more likely to produce unintended movement. I can do the bracketing part, however I need to tie in the single click factor into the equation. Please guide me in this process. Thanks in advance FutureFocus | | Fri 22-Mar-13 12:55 AM Registered since 18th Feb 2013

"RE: Set up D-90 for HDR 3 shot?" | In response to Reply # 0 MEMcD Nikonian since 24th Dec 2007 Fri 22-Mar-13 03:00 AM Hi Bruce, Welcome to Nikonians! >Does the D-90 have the capability to: >Automatically, i.e. "burst" mode (single shutter >depression) take 3 shots I think so but I don't have a D90 to test it. With other bodies if the Release mode is set to Continuous High or low when bracketing is On the shutter will release 1 set of bracketed images. >a) 2 stops apart (meter - under - over) Yes! In Bracketing mode, Bracketing progress 3F, Bracketing increment 2.0 Custom Setting e6
